description: Faced with spreading unrest after the BCI echo crisis, Nikola is granted temporary access to the hidden BCI messaging system and reviews Halden’s secret poetic message. He chooses to embed it into the active echoes as a gesture of peaceful unity.

Citizens begin to notice short, poetic phrases appearing in their BCI profiles and echo feeds. Each suggests compassion, resilience, and gentle defiance. Rumors quickly circulate linking these words to Halden’s enduring influence.

Community anxiety shifts to collective calm as the poems inspire coordinated, peaceful noncompliance. Spontaneous gatherings grow—people recite the new poetry aloud at service checkpoints, refusing BCI mandates for a day and helping one another where systems fail.

Council meets in emergency session to counteract the noncompliance wave, but Directorate patrols struggle to intervene amid citywide solidarity. BCI-dependent services temporarily stall, but no violence erupts.

With the BCI paralyzed, residents self-organize to maintain basic functions. The poetic messages become a citywide symbol of unity, fueling rumors that Halden foresaw this—the first day the system's control faltered due to collective, peaceful resistance.
